llm.feedback:
Up | 3–6 months | Regime A: easing lowers discount rates, lifting long-dated crypto valuations via a lower real rate and ongoing staking/ETF demand | What to watch: FOMC timing and CPI prints; regulatory clarity via GENIUS Act/Project Crypto | Probability 60% (OGK8WLL69)
Up | 3–6 months | Regime C: regulatory clarity and broader institutional access strengthen crypto demand; watch ETF inflows momentum and corporate treasury activity such as Bitmine Immersion's ETH allocation | Probability 58% (OGK8WLL69)
Down | 3–6 months | Regime B: inflation surprises or tariff shocks forcing a tighter policy path; watch September FOMC timing and CPI prints; Jackson Hole signaling remains a pivotal guardrail | Probability 40% (OGK8WLL69)(OGK8WLL69)
Down | 3–6 months | Regime D: policy error or a global macro shock disrupts the path; macro risk across cross-border spillovers and the Ford-cycle reminder underline real-economy sensitivity | Probability 35% (OGK8WLL69)(22PL3Q360)

Up | 3–6 months | Entry ~5,000 (ETH near highs ~4,955) (OGK8WLL69) | Stop ~4,400 (OGK8WLL69) | Target ~6,200 (OGK8WLL69) | R/R 2.0 | Invalidation weekly close below ~4,000 (OGK8WLL69) | Trigger weekly close above ~5,100 (OGK8WLL69) | Probability 65% | Confidence 70

Feedback: Strengthen world-class quality by tightening to a single, cohesive ETH-focused framework. Move all four movers to a clean four-scenario regime map with explicit, testable triggers (FOMC/CPI, regulatory milestones, ETF/inflows) and avoid mixing in lengthy private-market abstracts unless tightly tied to ETH’s value drivers. Ground each line in a strict first-principles chain: from regime driver (lower/higher discount rates) to observable catalyst (inflation path, policy signals, on‑ramp/regulatory clarity) to price-path implication (ETH valuations). Normalize time horizon to 3–6 months across lines and unify probability budgeting (e.g., 60–65% for Up, 35–40% for Down) with explicit confidence. Use exact, source-backed entry/exit levels only where cited (avoid vague “near highs” without a numeric anchor). Ensure every numeric claim has a source citation; reconcile any conflicts between sources (e.g., debt ranges vs. regime triggers) before finalizing. Finally, trim non-crypto ballast (private-market memos, Ford-cycle analogies) unless tightly integrated into the crypto thesis, and present a tight 1-line Swing Trade with explicit entry/stop/target/invalidations for rapid operability.
